Who is Solomon?

I am a full-stack web dev based in Irvine, California.



To support my psychology degree, I taught children how to code with OpenWorld Learning (OWL). During OWL's 20 year tenure, disadvantaged children found independence, built skills, and had fun with the Microworlds Curriculumn.

From 2015 - 2018, our students inspired many of us become programmers. We held monthly coding sessions, built demos, and studied teaching standards to educate our students. Over many hours, our students overcame mental blocks to become problem solvers. As OWL ceased operations, I took a chance on myself and tried this life path.

This decision would yield a 2 year journey of self-study, ~730 cups of tea, life-changing mentorship, new friends, and a fresh perspective. Today, I write clean code, have become a persistent problem-solver, and learn about the world through my projects. After work, you can find me staying active, singing with Voices of Reason, practicing voiceover, illustrating, or writing.
